data: Museo archeologico regionale Lilibeo Marsala - Baglio Anselmi

Facsimile Images

Ịṃ[p](eratori) [Caes(ari) M(arco) Aur(elio) An-]
tonino P̣ị[o Fel(ici) Aug(usto)]
Parṭ[h](ico) Max(imo) [Britanni-]
co [M]ax(imo) Gẹrm(anico) Ṃ[ax(imo)]
5pont(ifici) max(imo) trib(unicia) p͡o͡test(ate) [---]
f(elicissimo?) p(io?) p(rincipi?) imp(eratori) IIII co(n)s(uli) III[I p(atri) p(atriae)]
[proco(n)s(uli)] res [p(ublica)]
[Lilybita]ṇo[rum]
------

Apparatus criticus

Text of Silvestrini 2022

translation

commentary

The text is notable for the presence at the start of line 6 of the letters F P P separated by interpuncts, and somewhat smaller than the other letters of the inscription, which seem to abbreviate a series of sigla/epithets honouring Caracalla, and which by comparison with various other honorifics for Caracalla Silvestrini proposes to read (speculatively) as felicissimus, pius, princeps.

bibliography

  • Silvestrini 2020 298-299 no.2 with fig.6 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002609
  • Silvestrini 2022 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001579
